CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1953, pg. 2 reads: " 'Held for Federal Court - Alleged "pushers" and "junkies" nabbed during the recent Hill District narcotics dragnet found the going quite rough before United States Commissioner Harold Lavine last week and this week as they appeared before him on charges of having sold "junk" to Federal undercover agents. The agents' testimony included time, place, amount of dope and identification of the "pushers."  After discovering who one of the undercover agents was, some of the suspects plead guilty.  The rest were held for court on the basis of the damaging testimony and heavy bonds were imposed....Inset, Rosetta Robinson looks surprised as she views her accuser, a federal undercover agent, who charged she sold him heroin last summer....-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Rosetta Robinson wearing dark vest and plaid skirt, seated at desk awaiting arraignment on narcotics charges in Pittsburgh Federal Courthouse
